fr.sorbonne_u.components.hem2024e2.equipments.hairdryer.mil

Class HairDryerUserModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.Model

  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.hioa.models.interfaces.VariableDefinitionsAndSharingI, fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.hioa.models.interfaces.VariableInitialisationI, fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.interfaces.AtomicModelI, fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.interfaces.EventsExchangingI, fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.interfaces.ModelI, java.io.Serializable

    @ModelExternalEvents(exported={SwitchOnHairDryer.class,SwitchOffHairDryer.class,SetLowHairDryer.class,SetHighHairDryer.class})
public class HairDryerUserModel
extends fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.es.models.AtomicES_Model
    The class HairDryerUserModel defines a very simple user model for the hair dryer.

    Description

    This model is meant to illustrate how to program MIL models simulating user actions by sending events to other models.

    Here, we use an event scheduling atomic model to output events at random time intervals in a predefined cycle to test all of the different modes in the hair dryer. Note that the exported events are indeed subclasses of event scheduling events ES_Event. Hence, this example also shows how to program this type of event scheduling simulation models.

    Event scheduling models are constructed around an event list that contains events scheduled to be executed at future time in the simulation time. The class AtomicES_Model hence defines the main methods to execute the transitions. Internal transitions simply occurs at the time of the next event in the event list and then, if the event is internal, execute that event on the model (by calling the method executeOn defined on the event. If the next event is external, it must be emitted towards other models. This is performed by the method AtomicES_Model#output

    • Imported events: none
    • Exported events: SwitchOnHairDryer, SwitchOffHairDryer, SetLowHairDryer, SetHighHairDryer

    Glass-box Invariants

     invariant       STEP_MEAN_DURATION > 0.0
 invariant       DELAY_MEAN_DURATION > 0.0
 invariant       rg != null

    Black-box Invariants

     invariant       URI != null && !URI.isEmpty()
 invariant       MEAN_STEP_RPNAME != null && !MEAN_STEP_RPNAME.isEmpty()
 invariant       MEAN_DELAY_RPNAME != null && !MEAN_DELAY_RPNAME.isEmpty()

    Created on : 2023-09-29

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant
    See Also:

        public HairDryerUserModel(java.lang.String uri,
                          java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit simulatedTimeUnit,
                          fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.simulators.interfaces.AtomicSimulatorI simulationEngine)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        create a hair dryer user MIL model instance.

        Contract

         pre     uri == null || !uri.isEmpty()
 pre     simulatedTimeUnit != null
 pre     simulationEngine == null || !simulationEngine.isModelSet()
 pre     simulationEngine == null || simulationEngine instanceof AtomicEngine
 post    !isDebugModeOn()
 post    getURI() != null && !getURI().isEmpty()
 post    uri == null || getURI().equals(uri)
 post    getSimulatedTimeUnit().equals(simulatedTimeUnit)
 post    getSimulationEngine().equals(simulationEngine)
        Parameters:
        uri - URI of the model.
        simulatedTimeUnit - time unit used for the simulation time.
        simulationEngine - simulation engine to which the model is attached.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - to do.

      • generateNextEvent

        protected void generateNextEvent()
        generate the next event in the test scenario; current implementation cycles through SwitchOnHairDryer, SetHighHairDryer, SetLowHairDryer and SwitchOffHairDryer in this order at a random time interval following a gaussian distribution with mean STEP_MEAN_DURATION and standard deviation STEP_MEAN_DURATION/2.0.
